edu.rit.crst

Interface TestKernel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Kernel

    public interface TestKernel
extends Kernel
    Interface TestKernel specifies the interface for a GPU kernel function that computes the logarithms of the Bayes factors for all rounds and bit groups for a Test object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void computeTest(int NA, int NB, int R, int Csize, GpuIntArray C, int NBG, GpuStructMatrix<TestResult> testResult, int G, GpuIntMatrix pos, int a, int b)
      Compute the log Bayes factors.

      • Methods inherited from interface edu.rit.gpu.Kernel

        setBlockDim, setBlockDim, setBlockDim, setCacheConfig, setDynamicSharedMemorySize, setGridDim, setGridDim, setGridDim

    • Method Detail

      • computeTest

        void computeTest(int NA,
               int NB,
               int R,
               int Csize,
               GpuIntArray C,
               int NBG,
               GpuStructMatrix<TestResult> testResult,
               int G,
               GpuIntMatrix pos,
               int a,
               int b)
        Compute the log Bayes factors. The computeTest() kernel function is called with a 1-D grid of 1-D blocks. The rounds and bit groups are partitioned among all the threads in all the blocks. Each thread computes the log Bayes factors for certain rounds/bit groups, storing the results in the testResult matrix.
        Parameters:
        NA - Number of A inputs.
        NB - Number of B inputs.
        R - Number of rounds.
        Csize - C output bigint size in words.
        C - 3-D array of C output values.
        NBG - Number of bit groups.
        testResult - 2-D array of test results; testResult[r][g] is the log Bayes factor for round r bit group g, 0 ≤ r ≤ R−1, 0 ≤ g ≤ NBG−1.
        G - Bit size of bit groups.
        pos - 2-D array of bit positions in the bit groups; pos[g][p] is the original bit position for bit group g bit group position p, 0 ≤ g ≤ NBG−1, 0 ≤ p ≤ G−1.
        a - Input A index, 0 ≤ a≤ NA−1, or −1 to iterate over all A inputs.
        b - Input B index, 0 ≤ b≤ NB−1, or −1 to iterate over all B inputs.
